creator: bexterlab

title: Suddenly getting ads on Google in Firefox
content:
Hello, as of yesterday, I noticed that my Google searches were displaced by ads. If I search something, Google would normally display a short summary and a little piece of information at the top of the page, but instead the first ~10 results are all ads, one of the top ones always being yahoo.com. Same goes for searching for translations "[Any word] + language" normally results in the translation tool being displayed at the top, but again just ads.

I have scanned my PC for viruses (with the Windows Defender and Bitdefender) but at least they didn't find anything. When I deactivate all my extensions (Which is only Adblocker, ironically), nothing changes. When I browse in Safe Mode, the ads do not appear. I have already cleared my Cache etc. but that didn't do too much. No I installed a Scriptblocker and with that, Google is back to normal again. But of course, even if that workaround works, I'd also like to know what is causing this. (I also checked with Chrome for example, the problem is Firefox specific)

Any ideas what I could try next or what the problem might be?
creator: pandaderzwote

title: Youtube appearance defaults to dark when set to light.
content:
For the past week Firefox has been opening Youtube in dark when for the last decade I've been using light. Every time I change to light it works for that tab, if I open a new tab and load Youtube it opens in dark appearance. When I change to light and then click my avatar in the top right of Youtube it's still states I'm in dark when it's in light.

Why doesn't the light appearance stay? I've cleared cookies and that doesn't seem to work. It's also specific to Firefox, this doesn't happen in Microsoft Edge.
creator: immodium

title: Latest Firefox for Linux doesn't support HW acceleration with old Intel GMA 3000 GPU
content:
Hi!,

After spending days trying various online guides in technical blogs, forums e.t.c. to enable HW acceleration in Firefox to offload video decoding to the GPU, I decided as my last resort to post here.

I installed Linux Lite to an old laptop with intel GMA 3000 using the latest Intel drivers from Mesa in order to give it a new life using Linux and getting better performance. My initial intention was to use firefox (as I do in my desktop windows PC) but I wanted to get better performance and battery life by using GPU for video decoding. Intel GMA 3000 supports AVC1 (H264) decoding and it's very efficient. I have to say that Chrome fully supports this GPU and Video decoding in it's latest version (I have confirmed it using Intel_gpu_top utility).

Can someone here tell me if the aforementioned GPU can work together with Firefox Hardware acceleration implementation in order to support accelerated video decoding ?

If you need any information of my system please let me know.

Thanks in advance for your time.
creator: kallianiotis.nikolas

title: access to gmail
content:
this message is constantly preventing me from entering my g-mail site

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to myaccount.google.com because this website requires a secure connection. What can you do about it? myaccount.google.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site. The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

lease list a step by step process to deal with this issue, thanks

content:

Actually ideally what I want to happen is for all my devices to get their settings from the master computer, but any changes they make after that to be sent upstream to the mothership and vice versa

title: Firefox won't let me sign into Clickbank
content:
Only the Firefox browser is not allowing me to log into my Clickbank account, yet other browsers I have not issues with.

Going to: https://accounts.clickbank.com/login.htm and logging in, using Firefox, I get the following prompt: "Oops, there was an issue submitting your information. Please try again later. If this issue persists please contact our customer support team."

And, have been informed by the staff at Clickbank to try different things... which is how I came to discover that I CAN log into my Clickbank account using ANY browser EXCEPT Firefox.

I've cleared the cache and history from Firefox, I'm using standard for privacy anyway... and I've also cleaned my computer with CCleaner and rebooted the computer. I've check that I'm using the latest and greatest version of Firefox.

Yet, I STILL cannot log into my Clickbank account using Firefox.

ANY suggestions would be GREATLY appreciated, else I will need to STOP using Firefox, as I'm concerned that whatever is doing this, will start shutting me down from logging into all accounts, every where on the net.

Thank you in advance.
creator: trish.parr
